title: AI Content Writer, Artificial Generalized Intelligence Data Services (AGI-DS)
job_description:
Description
AI is the most transformational technology of our time, capable of tackling some of humanity’s most challenging problems. That is why Amazon is investing in generative AI and the responsible development and deployment of large language models (LLMs) across all of our businesses.
We are looking for highly motivated and talented candidates who will review generated data demonstrations and provide human feedback to train LLMs. The ideal candidate must demonstrate strong analytical and communication skills, attention to details, and a commitment to excellence.
This is a 11 months temporary assignment
Key job responsibilities
-  Create original and engaging content across multiple work types to train LLMs.
-  Write clear, concise, factually and grammatically correct responses that adheres to the Standard Operation Procedures (SOPs) and style guidelines to create visually appealing and effective content.
-  Proofread and edit content to ensure high-quality standards, accuracy, and consistency.
-  Research and verify content quality based on Content Guidelines. Approve or reject contents based on pre-defined guidelines and explain logical reasoning behind approve/reject decision.
-  Perform quality checks by reviewing and proofreading; provide feedback and training to co-workers and cross-company teams to ensure that quality standards are met.
-  Collaborate with cross-functional teams and other business units to monitor quality progress, investigate quality variations, develop and implement measures to drive quality improvement.
-  Develop a deep understanding of the subject matter expert (SMEs) for processes on the floor and collaborate with stakeholder teams to test new SOPs to gather insights, validate information, and ensure accuracy in content creation.
-  Support our leadership, business, and technical teams by actively participating in training, project/program management, etc., based on the group's needs and your own skills and inclinations.
About The Team
This is a full-time position based at our office location, Monday through Friday. Due to the nature of our business and the collaborative nature of our work, remote work options are not available for this role.
Are you ready to shape the future of human-technology interaction? Amazon is at the forefront of innovation, harnessing the power of generative AI to tackle some of society’s most pressing challenges. As we pioneer the responsible development and deployment of large language models (LLMs) across our diverse businesses, we invite visionary engineers to join our team. Amazon events throughout the year, AI Fundamentals, Diverse and Collaborative Team await for you.
Join Us! Be a part of Amazon’s journey in shaping the future of AI and human-technology interaction. If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve and thrive in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply. Together, let’s build a future where AI enhances the way we live and work.
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.
Basic Qualifications
-  Proven work experience as a Content Writer, Copywriter, or similar role.
-  Strong proficiency in English. Candidate must demonstrate language proficiency in all the following: verbal, writing, reading and comprehension.
Preferred Qualifications
-  Prior experience of 2-4 years in content writing
-  Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Linguistics, Journalism, Communications, or a related area, with a strong emphasis on creative writing, technical writing, or AI technology to help train generative artificial intelligence models to become better writers.
-  Ability to adapt writing style to suit various style guidelines and customers
-  Ability to make logical decisions while performing tasks even when provided information is ambiguous
-  Understanding of academic integrity, e.g.: plagiarism
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
Company
 - Amazon Support Services Costa Rica SRL
Job ID: A2870346

title: Data Analyst
location: San José, San Jose, Costa Rica
job_description:
Internal Audit's Digital and Analytics Services (DAS) team is seeking a data analyst with a history of innovation, collaboration and partnership to join our team. Internal Audit is chartered by the Audit and Finance Committee of Intel's Board of Directors to provide the Board and management with independent, objective advisory services and assurance on the effectiveness of governance, risk management and control processes. Internal Audit's work spans the breadth of Intel's operations, including manufacturing, engineering, technology development, supply chain, sales and marketing, and other corporate functions such as Information Technology. The DAS team supports the Internal Audit function by leveraging advanced analytics, data science, and automation to identify and assess risks, deliver projects, and increase the efficiency and effectiveness of Internal Audit's services.
This role offers a distinctive opportunity to apply aspects of advanced analytics and other data science disciplines to a variety of high-impact projects across many different functions and business groups throughout Intel in ways not typically experienced in other groups due to the unique nature of Internal Audit. This role will process, cleanse and verify integrity of data as well as use data analysis techniques such as ad hoc database queries, scripting, mathematics / statistics analysis to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and provide data-informed insights that describe, predict, or improve business performance and facilitate better business decisions or data-driven recommendations. The role will interact with a wide variety of master and transactional data from different functions across the enterprise and in various systems such as SAP/HANA, SAS, ECA, etcetera. The role also facilitates the development of business self service capabilities for data acquisition and reporting as well as may support the business in report and dashboard generation. Additionally, the role is a technical liaison between various business and technical teams. From time to time, the role may provide input into the establishment or revision of standards, guidelines, procedures, and other infrastructure or work with data architecture/developer teams to implement data modeling solutions or gather business requirements, decomposing them into data and technical requirements, including data flows to other systems.
Key Responsibilities
- Analyze data from various sources to identify trends, anomalies, and insights relevant to internal audit processes.
- Develop dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data or findings to stakeholders.
- Collaborate with audit teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in the development of data models and predictive analytics to enhance audit effectiveness.
- Conduct ad-hoc analyses as required to support audit projects and initiatives.
- Present findings and recommendations to management in a clear and concise manner.
- Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and internal audit.
The Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Behavioral Traits
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and translate findings into actionable insights.
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
- Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, or a related field.
1+ year of experience in the following:
- Data analysis or in a related role.
- Data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, DAX, Power Query, Python).
- PBI data visualization tool to create meaningful dashboards and reports.
Preferred Qualifications
- Experience with statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
- Knowledge of database management systems and data warehousing concepts.
As members of the Finance team, employees act as full partners in making and supporting business decisions that are aimed at maximizing shareholder value. Intel Finance has a strong focus on facilitating change and improvement both within finance and in the operations supported.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. 
* Job posting details (such as work model, location or time type) are subject to change.
We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

title: Data Engineer - Databricks - Senior
job_description:
Experience Remote done Right. With over 20 years of remote experience, all 500+ staff are 100% remote, and we still grow vibrant relationships and provide exceptional opportunities for career growth while working with stellar clients on ambitious projects.
What we're working on:
Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve daily are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. To grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.
Requirements
- 7+ years experience in a senior developer role using Python; ideally, you have delivered business-critical software to large enterprises
- You are comfortable manipulating large data sets and handling raw SQL
- Experience using technologies such as Pyspark/AWS/Databricks is essential
- Experience creating ETL Pipeline from scratch
- E-commerce and Financial Services industry experience preferred
- English fluency, verbal and written
- Personality traits: Professional, problem solver, proactive, passionate, team player.
Why Lumenalta is an amazing place to work at
At Lumenalta, you can expect that you will:
- Be 100% dedicated to one project at a time so that you can innovate and grow.
- Be a part of a team of talented and friendly senior-level developers.
- Work on projects that allow you to use leading tech.
The result? We produce meaningful outcomes for our clients that break barriers in their industries.
The job is 100% Remote; please ensure you have a comfortable office set at your desired work location.
Lumenalta is committed to hiring exceptional talent from a wide variety of diverse backgrounds. If you share our values and enthusiasm for digital transformation, we encourage you to apply
What's it like to work at Lumenalta?

title: Junior Data Analyst
job_description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst
Responsibilities:
· Provide regular updates and reports on data, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
· Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate and utilize data effectively. Participate in weekly sync meetings and coordinate with team members to address data-related issues.
· Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies. Present findings to the team to inform decision-making processes.
· Manage data, ensuring its integrity and security. Oversee data storage, handle data access requests, and maintain data quality standards.
· Design and update PowerPoint presentations that summarize data insights and findings for stakeholder meetings and presentations.
· Manage and analyze data using Excel. Create and maintain spreadsheets, use formulas to reduce manual effort, perform data analysis, and generate charts and graphs to visualize data trends and patterns.
· Use Power BI as a basic tool to extract data and create interactive visualizations. Set up data connections and ensure user-friendliness.
· Identify and implement process improvements to enhance data management and reporting efficiency.
· Understand and apply data modeling techniques to create accurate and meaningful reports.
· Communicate with stakeholders regarding data. Respond to queries, provide clarifications, and keep stakeholders informed about updates or changes related to the data.
Skills:
· Proficient in data analysis tools such as 
Excel
.
· Familiarity with data visualization tools like 
Power BI
.
· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
· Excellent communication skills to present findings to stakeholders.
Please note:
 This position is open only to candidates residing in Costa Rica. We will only review resumes submitted in English.

title: Senior Data Engineer
job_description:
Job Description: Data Engineer / Data Scientist (Databricks Expert)
Position Overview
We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer / Data Scientist with deep expertise in
Databricks to join our remote team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in
data modeling, R, and Python, particularly in data-centric workflows. Experience with ETL
tools and the upstream oil & gas industry—especially working with sensor and time-series
data—is a significant advantage. This role requires close collaboration with cross-functional
teams, making excellent communication skills essential.
Key Responsibilities
Data Modeling & Analysis
- Develop, maintain, and optimize complex data models to support analytics, machine
learning, and reporting.
- Use Python libraries (pandas, PySpark, numpy) to manipulate, transform, and analyze
large datasets.
- Leverage Databricks Delta Tables for efficient data lake operations, including versioning,
time travel, and ACID transactions.
Databricks Development
- Design and implement workflows on Databricks, including creating notebooks, managing
clusters, and optimizing compute resources.
- Implement best practices for data processing, pipeline monitoring, and performance
tuning in Databricks.
- Work with Databricks Delta Lake to manage data ingestion, schema enforcement, and
incremental data processing.
Scripting & Programming
- Use R for advanced statistical analysis and modeling.
- Utilize Python (numpy, pandas, PySpark, scikit-learn) for data pipelines, API integrations,
and automation.
- Implement version control (Git, CI/CD pipelines) for efficient code management.
ETL Process Management
- Develop and maintain robust ETL workflows using tools like Talend, Informatica, SSIS, or
similar.
- Ensure smooth data ingestion, transformation, and loading from multiple sources,
including streaming and batch-processing systems.
Domain-Specific Data Handling
- Apply upstream oil & gas industry knowledge to design specialized data workflows,
particularly for sensor-generated and time-series data.
- Work closely with domain experts to align solutions with industry best practices for real- time analytics and long-term data storage.
Remote Collaboration & Communication
- Actively participate in virtual team meetings and provide timely project updates.
- Document processes, share knowledge, and mentor junior team members.
- Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues using remote collaboration tools.
Required Qualifications
Education & Certifications
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field (Master’s
degree is a plus).
- Strong Databricks experience (certifications are a bonus).
Technical Skills
- Proficiency in Python (pandas, numpy, PySpark, scikit-learn) and R.
- Hands-on experience with Databricks, Delta Tables, and Delta Lake.
- Strong understanding of Spark SQL and PySpark for scalable data transformations.
- Experience designing and maintaining relational and non-relational data models.
- Experience with industry-standard ETL tools and best practices for data ingestion and
processing.
- Proven ability to work independently and effectively in a distributed, remote environment.
Preferred Qualifications
- Oil & Gas (Upstream): Experience with exploration, drilling, production, or asset
management data.
- Time-Series Data: Experience working with sensor and large-scale time-series datasets.
- Cloud Platforms: Experience with Azure, AWS, or GCP and their data services (Azure Data
Lake, AWS S3, GCP Cloud Storage).
